result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Walter Joseph Megna

records.addlTxt: Plea date on December 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Plea date on July 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:05 PM Defendant Walter Joseph Megna appeared in court, Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Walter Joseph Megna, Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.   Letter inducement was given.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information has been filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  March 4, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-02-22 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Walter Joseph Megna
Current: 1314 S. 21st Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 01-20-2022)
Prior: 1031 S 16Th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-24-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with the address 1031 S. 16th Street, Manitowoc, WI and that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
